fields.Chapter Title: The American Founders and the Problem of Civil Religion: Truth and Utility
fields.Book Title: The Most Sacred Freedom: Religious Liberty in the History of Philosophy and America’s Founding
fields.Description/Abstract: Modern thinkers and the American Founders in particular welcome a type of religious practice for its usefulness to political practice, but their approach to religion has the effect of undermining its usefulness when it is framed in the terms of utility.  Religion must be thought to be true to be useful.
